findings.title: The reset of mintCount by the owner does not follow the intended procedure.
findings.description: The resetMintCount() function allows the owner to bypass checkpoints and directly reset the mint count for any token contract, symbolizing excessive power in the hands of owners.

findings.title: setDailyMintLimit() function doesn’t validate the arguments.
findings.description: The setDailyMintLimit() function is responsible for updating the maximum daily mint limits of tokens but it doesn't include any input validations on the uint256 arguments passed to it, which could lead to an unwanted scenario where any invalid input passed to this function might stop new tokens from being minted.
